hint.text:
Compare the given \(n^{th}\) term equation with the general \(n^{th}\) term equation of A.P. is
\(a_n=a+(n-1)d\)

solution.text:
\(n^{th}\) term of an A.P. is
\(a_n=a+(n-1)d\)
\(a_n=(a-d)+nd\) ....(1)
where \(a\) =first term and \(d\) =common difference of the A.P.
given that
\( a_n= _{{p-q}}_ +_{q}_n\) ....(2)
Comparing equation (1) and (2)
d=_{q}_ (from the coefficient of n)
\(a-d=_{{p-q}}_\) (from the constants)
\(a=_{{p-q}}_+d\)
\(a=_{{p-q}}_+_{q}_\)
\(a=_{p}_\)

content.text: Find the sum of the first term and the common difference of the A.P whose \(n^{th}\) term is \( a_n= _{{p-q}}_ +_{q}_n\)
